message.content: A Hendiadys is a figure of speech in which two words or phrases are combined to create a single, more powerful statement. The two words or phrases often have a similar or related meaning and work together to emphasize the effect of the expression. This literary device is commonly used in poetry and prose to add depth and intensity to the language. An example of a Hendiadys can be seen in the phrase "eat one's heart out," which combines "eat" and "heart out" to express the idea of extreme desire or longing.
